intro: Cryptantha cinerea var. abortiva, commonly known as the pale cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain seeds that are dispersed by wind. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystem.
